page.title: 20 SOULDERN
page.content: The western part of Souldern is in this area. It is a small village with a {GARAGE} that sells petrol and repairs cars and a general store/Post Office. The {HOUSES} are mainly of stone and terraced though there are some large detached houses including the Manor. The {AGRICULTURE} is mainly cereal with a small number of grass fields near the river. Also in this area are 22 {ALLOTMENTS} which are used by villagers to grow vegetables. One feature of the village is the old {MILL} by the side of which is a ford which is where cars drive through the stream. The {OXFORD CANAL} and 2 {RAILWAY LINES} pass through; 1 to Oxford and the other crosses 2 viaducts on its way to High Wycombe and London (Marylebone)
